sentences.en: Certain drugs such as antidepressants and antihistamines predispose to dry mouth leading to halitosis.
sentences.cn: 特定的药物如抗抑郁药和抗组胺药可加剧口干并引起口臭.

sentences.en: Germ line mutations in BRCA 1 predispose women to early onset, familial breast and ovarian cancers.
sentences.cn: 人类乳癌易感基因1(BRCA1)的生殖细胞突变会导致早发性妇女乳腺癌, 遗传性乳腺癌和遗传性卵巢癌.

sentences.en: His modesty and generosity predispose people to like him.
sentences.cn: 他的谦虚和慷慨使得人们未经接触就喜欢他.

sentences.en: It has been theorized that a prenatal hormonal imbalance may predispose individuals to the disorder.
sentences.cn: 从理论上讲,父母亲性激素不平衡可能为孩子的病症留下根源.

sentences.en: No conditions exist that predispose the product to external contamination.
sentences.cn: 在任何情况下不允许将产品暴露于外界的污染物.

sentences.en: No other conditions exist that predispose product containers to external contamination.
sentences.cn: 此外,无其他状态会使容器有受到外界污染的倾向.

sentences.en: No other conditions exist that predispose the product containers to external contamination.
sentences.cn: 不存在可能导致产品外部污染的条件.

sentences.en: Perforated eardrums can predispose the ear to infection or result in hearing loss.
sentences.cn: 耳膜穿孔使耳部易于感染或导致听力丧失.

sentences.en: Smoking predispose people to dementia, not protect them as has been suggested in the past.
sentences.cn: 吸烟并非如此前所认为的那样使吸烟者罹患痴呆症的风险降低, 而是提高了该风险.

sentences.en: Theoretically, hypoxemic episodes during sleep apnea may predispose patients to oxidative stress.
sentences.cn: 理论上讲, 睡眠呼吸暂停时血氧不足的发作可能导致患者出现氧化应激.

sentences.en: There is evidence to suggest that certain factors predispose some individuals to criminal behaviour.
sentences.cn: 有证据表明，特定的因素会使某些人产生犯罪倾向。

sentences.en: They take pains to hire people whose personalities predispose them to serve customers well.
sentences.cn: 他们千方百计雇用那些性格上天生适合服务顾客的人。

words.tran_cn: 先有倾向的，先有意向的
预先有倾向的；预先处置好的（predispose的过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 使预先有倾向； 易受感染
trans.tran_en: to make someone more likely to suffer from a particular health problem

trans.tran_cn: 使预先有倾向，使易接受，使倾向于做，使易于患（病）
